newsitem.title: USA: Apache group sets Ivory Coast natgas sales.
newsitem.headline: Apache group sets Ivory Coast natgas sales.

text.p: Apache Corp said Tuesday a group it heads signed a 10-year take-or-pay contract commencing in 1999 to supply some 200 billion cubic feet of natural gas to an electric power plant in Abidjan, Ivory Coast.

The contract establishes the commerciality of the Foxtrot gas field in Block C-27, offshore Ivory Coast, where three wells tested a combined 115 million cubic feet of natural gas and 1,350 barrels of condensate per day in the early 1980's. Apache said reserves are estimated at 600 billion cubic feet. It is operator with a 24 percent interest.
The other participants, and their interests, are: PETROCI, Ivory Coast's national oil company, 40 percent; SAUR Energie, 24 percent; and Electricite de France, with 12 percent.

The take-or-pay commitment rises from 30 million cubic feet per day to 50 million after two years. The natural gas price will be based on a formula indexed to West Texas Intermediate (WTI) crude oil. A $20 WTI price per barrel would yield a price in excess of $2 per thousand cubic feet.
